data.text: @ruthsk8r Fine, how about Thelma & Louise then? Still doesn't change my opinion. And I guess I shouldn't have said "classic" because I just meant "old movies". Dirty Rotten Scoundrels is FAR from a classic, but Hollywood still found it important to remake.
@ruthsk8r @Merc_Media Just watched 3 billboards and it was incredibly interesting, original and entertaining. #Writers

@CameraguyRob @Merc_Media Every story can be boiled down to variations on a few different conflicts. I see no problem with swapping race or gender to offer a different perspective. It's only an issue if you're only interested in one (usually your own).
@ruthsk8r @Merc_Media The need for originality and not formula scripts are needed in Hollywood

@Merc_Media @CameraguyRob If every movie I ever saw was essentially about me and how great I am and I'm always the hero and every other character was a stereotype or filler, I probably wouldn't see the need to remake it from a different perspective either. When you're the filler, it's different.
@Merc_Media @superbang You're welcome to your opinion. Your opinion sucks.
@Merc_Media @superbang We all want to see more original characters. The ones who get funded have a lot in common, though. I just can't qwhite put my finger on it...

@Merc_Media @superbang You act like Hollywood is clambering to make diverse films. With a few exceptions, it isn't. It's clambering to make movies that appeal to white dudes, b/c the power players who make movies are white dudes. That's why those are the first ideas that get turned into movies.
@Merc_Media Sex and the City is your example of a "great" women's movie. That kind of says it all right there...

@superbang A gender-swapped remake of Dirty Rotten Scoundrels in my opinion is not going to move us forward. But my original point was just that it sounds like a lazy, uninteresting attempt by Hollywood.

@superbang Yikes, that's the response when someone speaks up with their opinion on cinema? Racism and misogyny? I don't want representation MY way, Hollywood will happily continue to make stuff I don't like and I'm fine with that, but will always have an opinion. Just as you.
@Merc_Media Or misogyny, or ableism, or classism.
@Merc_Media But if you only want representation your way, as a member of a dominant demographic, it's not representation it's compliance with systemic racism and colonialism
@superbang Not norms. Opinions. Preferences. Those I absolutely do get to have as an audience member. And I want to see more original characters pls.
@Merc_Media You're saying yes to diversity but only if it conforms to your norms. That's not diversity.

@superbang Well even as a cis-white (which I don't want to be simply labelled as) I do want some diversification in cinema. But do better than swapping one gender/race for another and rehashing the story. And even worse, marching it out to audiences as progressive to cash in.

@Merc_Media with respect, i'm not sure representation for marginalized peoples are really about what a cis-white male wants. the royal you already has everything else with regards to representation. I mean, if it's something you don't want to see, don't see it.
@Merc_Media Wait til they make the all female cast of "Jaws". LoL
